summary: An function-definition creates a new function within the enclosing module.
details: Let T denote the type system representation of a function F.
T is the type of a public static method.
T is synchronized, if F is a sync-function.
T is a member of the enclosing module-type.
A function creates a new scope for variables.
A function creates a new scope for labels.
A $AutumnLangExceptions$UnexpectedTerminationException$ is thrown automatically, if execution reaches the end of a function.
static-checks: Each annotation in an annotation-list must be uniquely typed.
A compilation-unit can only contain one @Start function.
A start-function must have a signature of: main(String[]) : void
A setup-function must have a signature of: () : void
A test-function must have a signature of: (TestCase) : void
An infer-function must have a signature of: (T, ...) : T, where T is some reference-type.
The type specified by parami.type must exist.
The type specified by parami.type must be accessible.
The type of each parameter must be a variable-type.
The type specified by return-type must exist.
The type specified by return-type must be accessible.
